body_html:
@peterjc123
Hi, first of all, thank you for building window version of pytorch, I'm really really appreciated your effort.

Now, I'm working on my RL project and use 'torch.multiprocessing'.
When I test my code,

def job():
print(1)

p = mp.Process(target=job)
p.start()

It doesn't show anything, so, I try the same code on mac and it works.
Moreover, when I try using my real code. I got "BrokenPipeError: [Errno 32] Broken pipe"

Can you tell me how should I start solving this probelm.

Thank you in advance :)

[Window 10, Python 3.6, torch 2.0.0]

body:
@peterjc123 
Hi, first of all, thank you for building window version of pytorch, I'm really really appreciated your effort.

Now, I'm working on my RL project and use 'torch.multiprocessing'.
When I test my code, 

def job():
    print(1)

p = mp.Process(target=job)
p.start() 

It doesn't show anything, so, I try the same code on mac and it works.
Moreover, when I try using my real code. I got "BrokenPipeError: [Errno 32] Broken pipe"

Can you tell me how should I start solving this probelm.

Thank you in advance :)

[Window 10, Python 3.6, torch 2.0.0]
